intro: Meridiana kraussii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions. Meridiana kraussii is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
